forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 58. West southwest wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 74, with temperatures falling to around 72 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the skies begin to unveil a promise of warmth, though not without the gentle whispers of the lingering marine layer. Currently, the air is crisp, predominantly clear, with only hints of the fog that often graces this city by the bay. There’s a lightness in the atmosphere, yet the ancient hills surrounding the Golden Gate stand as sentinels, often cloaked in mystery, suggesting that the classic fog may yet come rolling back in, as it loves to do around midday.

Throughout Thursday, the sun will take center stage, basking the city with its warmth. Anticipate a welcoming high nearing 74, tapering into the cooler embrace of the afternoon. A varied dance of winds—gentle at first, but picking up strength—will add a lively soundtrack to the day. Those venturing into the streets may find it refreshing to layer. A light jacket or sweater will serve as perfect companionship as the temperatures shift, particularly in grant towards evening when the coastal charm reasserts itself.

Given these promising conditions, a stroll through one of the city’s verdant parks would be delightful, with soft grass beneath your feet and the aroma of outdoor cafés beckoning you to partake in a leisurely coffee or pastry. Or, why not wander to a neighborhood bookstore, where the quiet ambience pairs beautifully with the gentle murmur of the city waking up? Whatever you choose, the day invites a reflective pace, perfect for savoring the unique character of San Francisco.
